content:
TEI Technical Council 12 March 2005 The Text Encoding Initiative

No source

 Cayless is new chair. Removed those whose terms have expired. Updated link to tei-council list archives. Added title and link for Gehrke. Added webpage and title for Ciotti. Removed Burnard email and added his homepage at his request; clarified term of non-voting membership for Burnard; added Viglianti homepage. Added Council members elected in October 2014. Removed outgoing members and appointed Council chair and updated intro text to reflect new bylaws JC as chair for 2014 fixed based on proofreading by others Added those elected for 2014-2015, updated Hawkins institution, updated description of appointed member per new bylaws Updated titles/affiliations for Cummings, Bauman, Cayless, and Burnard Updated title for Hawkins. Removed outgoing, added incoming members Updated homepage URL for Pierazzo. Updated title for Hawkins. Updated titles and affiliations for Rahtz and Cummings. Fixed spelling of Welzenbach's last name. Updated chair Updated Unsworth affiliation "TEI Board Representative (appointed)" changed to "Appointed by the TEI Board of Directors" to match Bylaws; updated LOu's affiliation and removed broken homepage link link to Unsworth's homepage; clarified composition of Council updates for 2010 elections added L. Romary as Chair; removed reference to editors updated to reflect 2007 election updated text Converted to P5

The TEI Technical Council is responsible for the development and maintenance of the TEI Guidelines and other TEI systems and resources. It recommends, evaluates, and implements new features and modifications of existing features, and supervises the overall development of each new version of the Guidelines. At the TEI annual members' meeting, the Council presents a report on current work, and minutes are available from the meetings of the Council as well. The archives of the TEI Technical Council mailing list are public accessible and ongoing and past work can be seen on the bug and feature request trackers on the TEI's SourceForge site.

The TEI Technical Council consists of eleven members elected to staggered two-year terms by the TEI membership at the Annual Meeting. The Council meets once or twice a year in person, and holds a telephone conference call roughly every other month. The TEI Council sometimes uses the TEI Council Wiki Page to organize agendas or other information relating to its meetings.

Current Technical Council Members Term January 2014 through December 2015 Assistant Professor, University of Rome "Tor Vergata" Senior Digital Research Specialist, Academic IT Services, University of Oxford Data Coordinator, Biblissima Humanities Computing and Media Centre, University of Victoria Digital Library Production Service, University of Michigan Library Carl-Maria-von-Weber-Gesamtausgabe / University of Paderborn Term January 2015 through December 2016 Digital Humanities Senior Programmer, Duke Collaboratory for Classics Computing, Duke University Independent Consultant Research Programmer, Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities, University of Maryland Project Manager, Austrian National Library XML Programmer-Analyst, Northeastern University
